titlestmt.titleproper: Coolidge Senior High School Oral History Project OHP028
titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of Coolidge Senior High School Oral History Project at DC Public Library
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Lisa Moore.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-24 10:03:29 -0400.

did.unittitle: Coolidge Senior High School Oral History Project Collection

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is housed in one box, 0.25 linear feet, and contains two series. The first series is organized alphabetically by last name of the first interviewee on the CD (some CDs contain multiple interviews) and contains 16 folders. The second series contains color 4"x6" photographs of the interviewees in two folders.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p:
Ingrid Drake, CGAP (Certified Government Auditing Professional), is a program analyst with the Office of District of Columbia Auditor (ODCA). Previously she was an investigator for the Washington-based nonprofit Project On Government Oversight (POGO); and was a writer, Pacifica Radio correspondent, and community educator living in Washington, DC. In 2007 at the time of gift, she was a local DC journalist, writing for several outlets: DC North, East of the River, Hill Rag, DC Radio Co-op, www.DCIndymedia.org, WPFW 89.3 FM - Pacifica Radio, and Free Speech Radio News. Contact info: IngridNatasha@yahoo.com.
The Calvin Coolidge Senior High School Oral History Project arose from Drake's professional relationship with Verna Avery-Brown; whom she met as a volunteer at WPFW 89.3 FM - Pacific Radio, where Avery-Brown was a news anchor.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The collection was donated to the Library by Ingrid Drake in 2007.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Basic archival processing procedures were applied to the collection when it was processed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
In 2007, Ingrid Drake coordinated the Coolidge Senior High School Oral History Project, interviewing 25 alumni, staff, teachers, and students of Calvin Coolidge Senior High School. Drake applied for and received a $5,000 grant from the DC Commission on the Arts and Humanities to obtain equipment and facilitate the interviews. A radio show was produced for WPFW of the final interviews; and bound copies of the interviews to give to the alumni. This collection is comprised of 16 audio CDs (14 CDs of 24 interviews of 27 people, plus two CDs for the final radio show), and 26 color 4"x6" photographs of 25 of the 27 interviewees (includes one duplicate photo). The radio show contains snippets of interviews interwoven with popular commercially recorded music.
The Coolidge Senior High School Oral History Project interviews reflect the school's history of student political and social activism, demographic changes in the student body, and a chronicle of school spirit between the mid-1960s to 1997. The earliest alumni interviews are from the class of 1965; the latest from class of 1997. Missing are interviews with alumni who graduated during the 1980s and much of the 1990s. Included are stories of a student chapter of the Black Panther Party, a student march with a coffin to the White House during the Vietnam War, student pushes for creating black studies in high school, mention of the DC riots, historic DC events, student clubs, sports and extracurricular activities, popular music and dances, and the activism of the alumni association. Interviewed are 27 people: Verna Avery-Brown, Vanilla Beane, Gregory Bell, Michael Blakey, Consuelo Ellis Brown, L. Nelson Burton, Christine Easterling, Kenneth Ellerbe, Terry Goings, Susan Gordon, Terri Jo Hayes, Jerome Johnson, Frank Jones III, Loretta Kelly, John Mercer, Ada Mitchell, Aric Moore, Donna Pixley, Philip PremDas, James Proctor, Shawn Ruffing, Harold Smith, Vincent Tate, Ray Weaver, Stephen Whitney, Sylvia Frazier Weathers, and Davey Yarborough.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Disc 1 of 2-disc set, compilation of oral histories of Coolidge Senior High School, Washington, DC.CD-R, 700MB, 80 minutes, Memorex. In plastic CD jewel case. Eleven tracks listed on inside cover. Notes include acknowledgments: Thanks to all the alumni who contributed their time and memories. Many thanks to Ms. Kelly her 11th grade and 12th grade classes. Terry Goings the PTSO, Frank Jones the Alumni Assn., L Nelson Burton, Ray Weaver, Alexander Cole, Eriqa Mason, Mario Horton, Shana Smith, Roshin Mathew, Hayden Wetzel of the Sumner School Archives, Selina Musuta and Radio Rootz, Ryme Katkhouda, the People's Media Center at Al-Fishawy Cafe, Matt Gilmore the Washingtoniana Collection, and WPFW Radio 89.3FM.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Disc 2 of 2-disc set, compilation of oral hstories of Coolidge Senior High School in Washington, DC. CD-R, 700 MB, 80 minutes. Memorex. In plastic CD jeewel case. Fourteen tracks listed on inside cover. Notes of acknowledgment: This project was made possible thru a grant from the DC Commission on the Arts and Humanities. For more information, contact Ingrid Drake, Project Coordinator, at theteachingreporter@yahoo.com or 202-577-3437.
